numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that several first-world countries have more than 50% of 15-24-year-olds.
2. These 15-24-year-olds believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. I wonder why Indonesia has a very high percentage of 15-24-year-olds.
4. These 15-24-year-olds in Indonesia believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
5. This relates to my community.
6. I am a high school student.
7. I am consistently surrounded by people who are 15-24 years old.
8. The graph samples people who are 15-24 years old.
9. My generation will be responsible for changing the world for the better.
10. This directly relates to my life.
11. I often hear a claim.
12. The claim is that people have a hopeful outlook about the world.
13. The claim is that people have an optimistic outlook about the world.
14. My generation will enter the workforce in the future.
15. My generation will become active citizens in the future.
16. The graph displays a percentage for each part of the world.
17. Each percentage is the percentage of 15-24-year-olds in that part of the world.
18. These 15-24-year-olds believe that each generation will positively impact the globe.
19. First-world countries tend to have higher percentages.
20. Second-world countries tend to have lower percentages.
21. Third-world countries tend to have lower percentages.
22. The headline for the graph is: The Next Generation: Will They Change the World?
